Milestone 3 (100 points)
Remember that no late submissions will be accepted. Each group is allowed to request for late
submission of only one of their milestones up to four hours after the deadline. After that, the
milestone will not be accepted.

Milestone 3 submission on Moodle is due Wednesday 11/19/2025 @ 23:00, and
presentations will take place during class on 11/12, 11/17, and 11/19 as scheduled in the
following Table.



dates

11/12/2025     milestone3-presentation (groups 1-4)

11/17/2025     milestone3-presentation (groups 5-8)

11/19/2025     milestone3-presentation (groups 9-12)




Milestone 3 is divided into 5 parts. The first part is a report on your progress with your project
so far. The second part is your project presentation. The third part is your updated agile project
plan, user story template, and outline of tasks (i.e., the three spreadsheets you submitted with
Milestone 1). The fourth part is to share your GitHub project with me (please make sure to give
me access to the project). Finally, you will evaluate your fellow group members.



Report Requirements (30 points)
Upload a PDF document to Moodle that completes the Report Template document. Only one
submission per group is required.



Presentation Requirements (20 points)
Everyone in your group will present their projects. Your presentation should be at least 25
minutes long but no more than 30 minutes. All group members must talk for an equal amount
of time. Your presentation should follow this outline:
   1. Introduce everyone on the project team with your project title
   2. Provide a brief summary of what your project does (basically remind your classmates
      what you presented in Milestone 2)
   3. Demo your current project functionality. You must have at least 70% of your project
      working by this milestone.
   4. Demo the backend and frontend code of your project that you developed so far.
   5. Provide a brief status of what still needs to be done before Milestone 4.

You may use a PowerPoint presentation, a poster, document, or any other tool you like. Upload
your group’s presentation materials to Moodle (only one submission per group is required).



Project Plan (20 points)
Submit your updated agile project plan, user story template, and outline of tasks (i.e., the three
spreadsheets you submitted with Milestone 1). You may use a different format if you like, but
you must include which group mates will work on which tasks in the weeks between Milestone
3 and Milestone 4. Only one submission per group is required.



GitHub Project (20 points)
Your project must be uploaded to GitHub and shared with me. Please make sure I have access
to it. It is entirely up to you how to manage your branches and whether you want to make your
repo public or private. However, all group members must have at least 3 commits by this
milestone. Please note that these three commits should not be one-line changes, but rather
reflect a meaningful contribution to the project.

, all group members must have at least 3 commits by this
milestone. Please note that these three commits should not be one-line changes, but rather
reflect a meaningful contribution to the project.



Group Evaluation Form (10 points)
All group members must submit a group evaluation form. The group evaluation forms will
impact your grade. There is no specific form, just write your assessment and upload it on
Moodle along with other documents under Milestone3.
